definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: The cosmos has solemn order and orbicular harmony.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙具有严整的秩序，圆满的和谐。

sentences.english: Their troop is famous for its neat carriage.
sentences.chinese: 他们这个部队向来以军风严整著称。

sentences.english: Solid text with no signposts is off-putting and difficult to digest.
sentences.chinese: 过分严整没有标记的文章令人不愉快，并且很难消化。

sentences.english: The first is a comprehensive framework of China's good governance evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 一套是体系较为严整的中国善治评价指标体系框架。

sentences.english: Paper cut in South China is well known for its exquisite, elegant, realistic style.
sentences.chinese: 而南方剪纸玲珑剔透严整优雅，以写实风格著称。

definition: strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
lit. if he orders you go, he forbids you stop (idiom); fig. to demand exact compliance with instructions/to ensure strictly obedience
everything clear and in good order (idiom); neat and tidy
to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
